page.title: 20THE RIVER IRWELL
page.content: The{River Irwell}rises one and a half miles north of the town of Bacup,is joined as it flows through Rawtenstall by the Limy Water and in Irwell Vale by the River Ogden,and flows through our block from North to South. After passing through Salford and Manchester,it eventually joins the River Mersey and enters the sea off Liverpool.The villages of Edenfield and Stubbins are situated on the valley sides in the river's middle course.The river contributed to the industrial development which took place during the nineteenth century and still suffers from pollution from factories and mills along its course. In recent years several organisations, such as the{Rossendale Groundwork {Trust},have tried to improve the quality of the river and its surroundings.
